009package imagingbook.common.math;
010
011import java.util.Random;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015
016public class RandomMatrixGenerator {
017        
018        private final Random rg;
019        
020        public RandomMatrixGenerator(long seed) {
021                this.rg = new Random(seed);
022        }
023        
024        public RandomMatrixGenerator() {
025                this.rg = new Random();
026        }
027        
028        public RandomMatrixGenerator(Random rg) {
029                this.rg = rg;
030        }
031        
032        public double[][] makeRandomMatrix(int rows, int cols, double s) {
033                double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
034                for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) {
035                        for (int j = 0; j < cols; j++) {
036                                double x = s * 2 * (rg.nextDouble() - 0.5);
037                                A[i][j] = x;
038                        }
039                }
040                return A;
041        }
042        
043        public double[][] makeRandomMatrix(int rows, int cols) {
044                return makeRandomMatrix(rows, cols, 1.0);
045        }
046        
047        /**
048         * Creates and returns a square matrix of size n x n with
049         * random values in [-s, s].
050         * @param n the matrix size
051         * @param s the value scale
052         * @return a random matrix
053         */
054        public double[][] makeRandomSquareMatrix(int n, double s) {
055                double[][] A = new double[n][n];
056                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
057                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
058                                double x = s * 2 * (rg.nextDouble() - 0.5);
059                                A[i][j] = x;
060                        }
061                }
062                return A;
063        }
064        
065        /**
066         * Creates and returns a square matrix of size n x n with
067         * random values in [-1, 1].
068         * @param n the matrix size
069         * @return a random matrix
070         */
071        public double[][] makeRandomSquareMatrix(int n) {
072                return makeRandomSquareMatrix(n, 1.0);
073        }
074        
075        /**
076         * Creates and returns a square symmetric matrix of size n x n with
077         * random values in [-s, s].
078         * @param n the matrix size
079         * @param s the value scale
080         * @return a random matrix
081         */
082        public double[][] makeRandomSymmetricMatrix(int n, double s) {
083                double[][] A = new double[n][n];
084                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
085                        for (int j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
086                                double x = s * 2 * (rg.nextDouble() - 0.5);
087                                A[i][j] = x;
088                                if (i != j) {
089                                        A[j][i] = x;
090                                }
091                        }
092                }
093                return A;
094        }
095        
096        /**
097         * Creates and returns a square matrix symmetric of size n x n with
098         * random values in [-1, 1].
099         * @param n the matrix size
100         * @return a random matrix
101         */
102        public double[][] makeRandomSymmetricMatrix(int n) {
103                return makeRandomSymmetricMatrix(n, 1.0);
104        }
105        
106        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
107        
108        public static void main(String[] args) {
109                RandomMatrixGenerator rg = new RandomMatrixGenerator(17);
110//              RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(rg.makeRandomSymmetricMatrix(3));
111                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(rg.makeRandomMatrix(3 , 5,  1));
112                System.out.println("M = \n" + Matrix.toString(M));
113                System.out.println("M symmetric = " + MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(M, 1e-6));
114                
115                
116                
117                
118                RealMatrix Z = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
119                                {{-640324.756071648600000, -13455.063269205853000, -271133.849253710070000, -22199.258754168728000}, 
120                        {-13455.063269205852000, 565371.765546445600000, -16613.193426604714000, 58.180548072531145}, 
121                        {-271133.849253710070000, -16613.193426604714000, 74939.976000059920000, 1080.126330774859300}, 
122                        {-22199.258754168724000, 58.180548072531160, 1080.126330774859000, 13.014525143606523}}
123                );
124                
125                System.out.println("Z symmetric = " + Matrix.isSymmetric(Z, 1e-12));
126                
127        }
128
129}
